Description: Pottery counter shaped from a reused sherd of a Nile vessel, probably a bowl or plate with a red rim as a red coloured band is still visible on the rear and the section thins out. The edges are well smoothed with a rectangular section. The upper side shows a pattern of incised lines forming a cross with two further lines running from the half of each line towards the outer edge.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Amara West (Nubia), D15, Mound β, square l, level 1 (sand)
Bibliographic references: Spencer 1997 / Amara West I, The Architectural Report (p. 211)
